svg.text: 4 runs are combined for each sample (merge.sh)
sample names are unified in the
the 8 files are sorted and indexed
make database of SNPs (all the scripts in maakDatabases on GitHub)
paralell using Queue (works but requires a lot of cores and still takes some days for one sample)
extract SNPs that are not filtered out
extract regions of 250 bases before and after the SNPs (dna_van_ref.R)[filtered_snps_seq.csv] and
convert to fasta to allow blasting (sed script in comment of dna_van_ref.R)[filtered_snps_seq.fasta]
the regions before and after the SNP are BLASTed against the consensus genomes (blast_primers.sh),
which will result into a json file [filtered_snps_first part of sample name.json],
that will be converted to a file that will be used to test whether the region
appears 1 or (0 or multiple times)[numlines_first part of sample name.txt] at that consensus genome.
Using that file a new sequence file is created that only contains sequences that occur 1 time on the genome.
The numbers of resulting SNPs (/2 sequences) are logged.
Extract 300 SNPs that are contrained to the filter conditions and most of them consist of more than 1 mutation
(SNPstats.R)[SNP_V2.csv] and convert them to fasta (sed expression inside SNPstats.R)[SNP_V2.fasta]
consensus genomes are made by the use of bcftools
create database and fill with all SNPs (maak_snp_db.sh)
fill table with unique position chromosome
sample-enum.csv is used as table to
convert sample names to a number
combine bcf files of organisms to 1 with as
create database and fill with all SNPs (maak_acht_database.sh)
create database and fill with all SNPs (maak_drie_database.sh)
extract SNPs that do not has a
neighbour but are not filtered out
select limits on a quality plot and
convert database rows of acht.db back to
convert last fasta chromosome/position pairs back to database[FILTERED_VALIDATE_FR]
and add a table containing the valid SNPs [EXULANS_VALID] (filter2db.R)
show histogram of number of times hits are found
convert bcf-file to bed file to allow for
filter out SNPs that do not comply to
